p: Although certain regions of Europe are climatically hospitable to Aedes aegypti, the primary vector for dengue, the risk is currently rather low, as this primary vector is not established in Europe and vector control measures are established (ECDC 2012). However, Aedes aegypti has been implicated for occasional dengue epidemics in Europe, including the epidemic that affected Madeira, Portugal in 2013 (ECDC 2013).
